body_html:
Well, you'll want to make sure that pip3 is installed to the python interpreter you're then trying to import tensorflow in. In other words, try starting python3 instead.

As you're on Windows, you might have fewer headaches by relying on prebuilt packages via conda instead. https://www.anaconda.com/downloads
body_text:
Well, you'll want to make sure that pip3 is installed to the python interpreter you're then trying to import tensorflow in. In other words, try starting python3 instead.
As you're on Windows, you might have fewer headaches by relying on prebuilt packages via conda instead. https://www.anaconda.com/downloads
body:
Well, you'll want to make sure that `pip3` is installed to the `python` interpreter you're then trying to `import tensorflow` in. In other words, try starting `python3` instead.

As you're on Windows, you might have fewer headaches by relying on prebuilt packages via conda instead. https://www.anaconda.com/downloads
